content: The Act titled "Medicare Fraud Enforcement and Prevention Act of 2013" enhances criminal penalties to combat Medicare and Medicaid fraud. The "Medicare Fraud Enforcement and Prevention Act of 2013" increases penalties for Medicare and Medicaid fraud, including raising fines to $50,000 and imprisonment for up to 10 years for certain offenses. Additionally, a new subsection prohibits the illegal distribution of Medicare or Medicaid beneficiary information. A new subsection prohibits the distribution of beneficiary information, with penalties of up to 10 years in prison or fines equal to the monetary loss to the government.
